channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump pushed for grisly anti-fentanyl ads airing now
item.description: President Trump was a key booster of a series of grisly TV ads portraying the dangers of fentanyl — commercials that are now drenching the airwaves in...

item.title: What's different about the Charlie Kirk firings
item.description: Companies are reacting to pressure from Republican officials and right-wing activists and quickly firing anyone who attempts to justify or minimize th...

item.title: Who wins and who loses from fewer corporate earnings reports
item.description: President Trump suggested on Monday that U.S. public companies should not be required to report earnings quarterly, but on a six-month schedule instea...

item.title: It's not just you: Summer is sticking around longer
item.description: Data: Climate Central ; Map: Axios Visuals. Note: The 75th percentile temperature is based on the 1991-2020 reference period. Summer temperatures are ...

item.title: Republicans embrace speech limits after Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: President Trump and MAGA spent years lampooning censorship, discrimination against conservatives, and progressive "cancel culture." Now in power — and...

item.title: Some Americans abroad can’t send mail to U.S. because of tariffs
item.description: Many countries have halted or slowed regular mail amid confusion over new Trump tariff rules.

item.title: Trump files defamation and libel lawsuit against New York Times
item.description: President Trump accuses the newspaper and its reporters of defaming him in a book and three articles he said were “false, malicious, defamatory, and d...

item.title: Congress moves to counter Hegseth on base names that evoke Confederacy
item.description: The effort, pushed by Democrats and some Republicans, is tied to must-pass legislation winding its way through the House and Senate.

item.title: Trump heads to U.K. for carefully choreographed state visit
item.description: President Donald Trump returns to the U.K. at the invitation of King Charles III, for a trip designed to avoid controversy and protests.

item.title: It’s Election Day in a Minnesota suburb — because of political violence
item.description: A Tuesday special election will decide who fills the seat once held by former state House Speaker Melissa Hortman (D), who was shot dead, along with h...

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Trump fires statistics chief after soft jobs report
item.description: The monthly jobs report showed just 73,000 jobs in July, with big reductions to May's and June's numbers

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
